directories.name: 553_tiled_mode
directories.description: This section talks about how Tensor and Tensor access work in tiled mode.

directories.name: 554_im2col_mode
directories.description: Im2col mode supports the following tensor dimensions : 3D, 4D and 5D. In this mode, the tensor data is treated as a batch of images with the following properties:

directories.name: 555_im2colw_and_im2colw128_modes
directories.description: These modes are similar to the im2col mode with the restriction that elements are accessed across the `W` dimension only while keeping the `H` and `D` dimension constant.

files.title: Overview
files.summary: A tensor is a multi-dimensional matrix structure in the memory. Tensor is defined by the following properties:

files.summary: Tensor data can be accessed in two modes:

files.title: 5.5.6. Interleave layout
files.summary: Tensor can be interleaved and the following interleave layouts are supported:

files.title: 5.5.7. Swizzling Modes
files.summary: The layout of the data in the shared memory can be different to that of global memory, for access performance reasons. The following describes various swizzling modes:

files.title: 5.5.8. Tensor-map
files.summary: The tensor-map is a 128-byte opaque object either in `.const` space or `.param` (kernel function parameter) space or `.global` space which describes the tensor properties and the access properties of the tensor data described in previous sections.
